Colour

public Colour(long rgb)
Instantiates the colour based upon a 24-bit RGB value. (This is how we store colours in the database, among other things.) The value has one byte each (high to low) for the red, green, and blue components. To get a compatible value, you can call @see{toLong}

Parameters:
rgb - The combined RGB colour value

Colour

              short g,
              short b)
       throws DataException

g - green
b - blue
Throws:
DataException - if any value is out of range

Colour

public Colour(String rgb)
       throws NumberFormatException,
              DataException

Constructor: Instantiate a Colour object based upon the CSS, HTML, or JSON style of colour string.

  • The "CSS style" uses a decimal triplet in the form rgb(R,G,B) (the literal string "rgb(" identifies it).
  • The "HTML style" uses a # sign followed by either 3 or 6 hex characters, in the form #RGB or #RRGGBB.
  • The "JSON style" will include the prefices "r:", "g:", and "b:" followed by decimal values, separated by commas, with the order ignored.
  • A “straight integer” can also be used, in the form ( red << 16 & green << 8 & blue )

If the colour value passed does not fully specify a colour, uninitialized channels will be set to 0. EG: A JSON string of {r:255} or #f or rgb(255) is identical to #f00 or rgb(255,0,0) or {r:255,g:0,b:0}.

RFE: This routine could be expanded to accept the Tango colour palette using name strings.

Parameters:
rgb - The colour specification string (in some supported format)
Throws:
NumberFormatException - WRITEME
DataException - WRITEME

toInt

public int toInt()
Returns:
a 24-bit value (in a integer) representing the combined red, green, and blue values, one byte per each.

toJSON

public org.json.JSONObject toJSON()
                           throws org.json.JSONException
Create a JSON object specifying this colour.

Returns:
a JSON object representing this colour. Example: {r:0,g:255,b:255} represents cyan.
Throws:
org.json.JSONException - if the data cannot be stored for some reason

toLong

public long toLong()
Returns:
a 24-bit value (in a "long" integer) representing the combined red, green, and blue values, one byte per each.

toString

public String toString()
Creates a representation of this colour as a string compatible with CSS: specifically, the prefix "rgb" with the parenthesized values of red, green, and blue, in decimal, in the range 0..255. For example, chromatic cyan would be: "rgb(0,255,255)"

Overrides:
toString in class Object
See Also:
Object.toString()

toStringHTML

public String toStringHTML()
Returns:
a HTML-style string in the form #rrggbb (hex)
